text:
See Ava DuVernay’s Anti-Trump Statement at the Oscars The director wore a dress by a designer from a predominantly Muslim country. by 
https://twitter.com/ava/status/836024248887984128?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw Ava DuVernay made a statement at the Oscars from the moment she stepped on the carpet. The director, who was nominated for her film 13th , wore a dress by designer Mohammed Ashi from Saudi Arabia. Ashi launched Ashi Studio in Beruit, Lebanon, 10 years ago. DuVernay tweeted about her dress alongside a photo of the lacy gray gown on the red carpet. “A small sign of solidarity,” she wrote. “I chose to wear a gown by a designer from a majority Muslim country. Thanks to @AshiStudio of Lebanon.” DuVernay’s sartorial choice follows President Trump’s immigration ban on seven predominantly Muslim countries. Her dress was only the beginning of anti-Trump statements at tonight’s awards. Iranian film director Asghar Farhadi , who won the award for best foreign film, did not attend the awards in solidarity with those affected by the ban. In January, DuVernay tweeted about the immigration ban, and specifically, how Farhadi would be affected by it. “Amplifying words of one of my favorite filmmakers, Asghar Farhadi, who like too many others will be turned away from the Land of the Free,” she wrote above a quote from Farhardi’s 2012 Oscar acceptance speech for his film A Separation . Oscars 2017 Best-Dressed Celebrities: See the Head-Turning Looks Ruth Negga in Valentino RUTH NEGGA IN VALENTINO 
Negga has been a red carpet stand-out all season long—scoring a Vogue cover along the way—and at the Oscars she opted for a somewhat daring red almost Gothic-sque look that we are very much digging. Photo: By Rob Latour/REX/Shutterstock EMMA STONE IN GIVENCHY 
This is the kind of dress you wear when you know you’re going to win an Oscar. Photo: By Steve Granitz/Getty Images. KARLIE KLOSS IN STELLA MCCARTNEY 
Kloss is giving us extreme “Gwyneth Paltrow Tom Ford Oscar Dress” flashbacks here, and it is working. Photo: By Jeff Kravitz/Getty Images. TARAJI P. HENSON IN ALBERTA FERRETTI 
The sheer force of this look is enough to give us the energy and inspiration to get through what is sure to be a very long night. Photo: By Steve Granitz/Getty Images. SCARLETT JOHANSSON IN ALAÏA 
This is a more floral and feminine ScarJo look than we are used to from her, and the gown, in tandem with the striking hair, combines for a very powerful effect. Photo: By Kevin Mazur/Getty Images. CHARLIZE THERON IN DIOR 
Theron’s hair is similar to Scarlett Johansson’s (and their dresses have a kind of similar cut) and if we don’t get a picture of the two of them together by the end of the night, we will be very disappointed. Photo: By Frazer Harrison/Getty Images. JANELLE MONAE IN ELIE SAAB
